hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util

Class SingleOption<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.SingleOption<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the contained value type

    public final class SingleOption<T>
extends Object
    Container that may contain a single value or an exception, but not both.

    The caller may add a single value or exception to this container. Any subsequent add attempt results in IllegalStateException.

    The caller may retrieve the value or exception from this container, which is then removed from the container; the caller may add a new value or exception. If the caller attempts to remove a value or exception after a value, it will result in IllegalStateException.

    The class is not thread safe.

    Since:
    0.97
    Author:
    akarnokd, 2013.01.12.

        public T take()
        Takes the current value or throws a RuntimeException if there is an error instead.

        The container must be full, and gets empty after the call.

        Returns:
        the value contained

      • takeError

        @Nonnull
public Throwable takeError()
        Takes just the exception from this container. The container becomes empty after the call. If the container doesn't hold an exception, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the exception

      • hasError

        public boolean hasError()
        Returns:
        check if there is an error in this container

      • option

        @Nonnull
public Option<T> option()
        Returns:
        Consumes the content of this container in a form of an option instance. The container becomes empty after it.

      • addOption

        public void addOption(@Nonnull
             Option<? extends T> o)
        Add a new optional value to the container. The container must be empty. Throws IllegalArgumentException if o is None.
        Parameters:
        o - the option to add
